title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 510.15 - Withdrawal of appeal or motion
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 510.15 - Withdrawal of appeal or motion

State Regulations

With the exception of a defendant's appeal
to the Court of Appeals from a judgment including a sentence of death pursuant
to C PL 450.70(1), an appeal may be withdrawn and discontinued at any time
prior to argument or submission by forwarding to the clerk of the Court of

Appeals a duly executed stipulation of withdrawal, which must be signed by all
counsel, and by the defendant personally. A motion may be withdrawn at any time
prior to its return date by filing with the clerk a written request signed by
counsel for the moving party. A request to withdraw a motion after submission
must be supported by a stipulation of withdrawal signed by all
counsel. Notes

510.15

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
